thread.title: How Manchester United should line up against St Etienne | Metro News
thread.title_full: How Manchester United should line up against St Etienne | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: How Manchester United should line up against St Etienne | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 12:31 pm Jose Mourinho’s side face St Etienne on Thursday (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United take on St Etienne in the first leg of their Europa League last-32 tie at Old Trafford on Thursday and Jose Mourinho will be keen to take an advantage to France for the second leg. 
The Red Devils will have to contend with a compact fixture list in the coming weeks and face Blackburn Rovers in the FA Cup on Sunday before the return leg against St Etienne next Wednesday. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
Mourinho will stress the importance of taking one game at a time but even he must secretly have one eye on United’s EFL Cup final with Southampton later this month. 
Rotation will be key in the coming weeks and, with that in mind, here’s how the Red Devils should line up. 
While Mourinho may be tempted to give Sergio Romero a rare outing, United cannot afford to take risks and David De Gea should retain his spot. 
The Spaniard won the Europa League with previous club Atletico Madrid and he’s been in fine form – again – in recent weeks. Man Utd 3-0 St-Etienne player ratings: Ibrahimovic hat-trick puts tie to bed 
Ahead of him, Mourinho’s intimated that he’ll stick with the same back four that played against Watford on Saturday but Antonio Valencia could do with a rest on the right hand side. 
The full-back’s been one of United’s best performers this term but he should be wary of burnout and Timothy Fosu-Mensah has been criminally underused so far this term. Eric Bailly’s expected to start against St Etienne (Picture: Getty) 
In midfield, Paul Pogba’s adapted better to a two-man midfield in recent weeks than he did at the start of the season. 
The Frenchman started the season alongside just one central midfield partner but Mourinho switched to a 4-3-3 to curb some of the defensive responsibilities placed on Pogba’s shoulders. 
However, Mourinho praised Pogba for his defensive work on the weekend and he will certainly start against the Ligue 1 side, where his brother, Florentin plays. 
Ander Herrera’s form has dipped in recent weeks and Marouane Fellaini deserves to start at Old Trafford. The Belgian’s recovered from being booed against Tottenham in December and scored against Wigan in the last round of the FA Cup. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (H) Thu 16 Feb Blackburn – FA Cup (A) – Sat 18 Feb St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr 
The most likely area that Mourinho will rotate is in attack, where the Portuguese has an abundance of options. 
The 2-0 win against Watford was seen as Anthony Martial’s revival moment this term and it would seen a discouraging message to the Frenchman if he’s dropped again on Thursday. 
The former Monaco forward had Watford’s defence on toast throughout the game at the Theatre of Dreams and Mourinho will want a fast start on Thursday in the hope that United could finish the tie in the first leg. Martial was superb against Watford (Picture: Getty) 
Henrikh Mkhitaryan is another that’s playing too well to drop and the game is the perfect opportunity to play the Armenian in his favoured number 10 role behind Zlatan Ibrahimovic. 
On the right wing, Juan Mata could retain his spot but it’s a good chance for Jesse Lingard or Marcus Rashford to get some game time – with the former more likely to start.
